intro: Stevenia axillaris, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves with a velvety texture, and small, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. Stevenia axillaris prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
